key_channel_insights.line_content: OTAs price above CI.com on 93 % of routes, yet the uplift is only 0.09 %, suggesting limited near-term revenue impact but continued brand-price misalignment.
Metasearch parity jumped to 65 % (+10 ppts WoW) while average undercut narrowed to –0.06 %, signalling improved price control.
97 % of GDS fares are higher by an average 5 %, making this channel the largest source of over-pricing and potential competitiveness risk.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: OTAs list higher prices than CI.com on 93 % of routes; average uplift is a negligible 0.09 %.
Website fare missing on 6.6 % of OD pairs (+1 ppt WoW), signalling mapping or distribution gaps.
OTA-cheaper cases resurfaced on 0.3 % of routes (–0.16 % gap) after a month of absence.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 93.1 % of fares are higher on OTAs; premium narrowed to 0.09 % (-0.01 ppt WoW).
Missing fares climbed to 6.6 %, up 1 ppt WoW.
Only 0.3 % of itineraries are OTA-lower; monitor for competitive shifts.
No price-parity cases observed across the network.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul shows 93 % OTA-higher with a 0.09 % premium; offer gaps also at 6.6 %.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 96.6 % OTA-higher with a slightly larger 0.11 % premium; zero undercuts.
OTA-higher share falls to 89.6 %; undercuts 0.7 % and offer gaps 9.7 %.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 94.0 % OTA-higher (-2 ppt WoW); no undercuts; offer gaps 6.0 %.

mse_highlights.line_content: Website-to-MSE parity surged 10 ppts WoW to 64.8 %, reversing prior erosion.
MSE prices below CI.com on 34.2 % of ODs, but average gap is just –0.06 %.
MSE-higher cases remain rare (0.3 %) with a +0.25 % delta.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Not-found fares edged up to 0.7 %, still operationally minor.
Parity rose to 64.8 % (+9.7 ppts WoW; +15 ppts MoM).
MSE-cheaper share fell 10 ppts WoW to 34.2 %; gap slim at –0.06 %.
MSE-higher steady at 0.3 %; reputational risk minimal.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: Entire short-haul sample mirrors network results: 64.8 % parity, 34.2 % undercut.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Parity 72.7 %; no MSE-higher; undercuts limited to 26 % at –0.07 %.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Parity 65.7 % (+13.7 ppts); same 34.3 % undercut share but smaller –0.04 % gap.

gds_highlights.line_content: 97 % of GDS fares priced above CI.com with an average +5 % mark-up.
Only 2 % of itineraries cheaper in GDS, averaging –10 %.
GDS-higher share eased 0.44 ppt MoM, indicating slight but non-structural progress.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 97.35 % fares carry a +5 % premium; change negligible WoW.
2.32 % of fares undercut CI.com by –10 %; incidence down 0.31 ppt WoW.
No missing fares, down from 0.34 % last month.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 96.55 % higher; +6 % premium; over-pricing share down 0.82 ppt MoM.
98 % higher; premium moderates to +4 %; parity still just 1 %.
